intro: Struthiola sulcata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems that give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Struthiola sulcata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique growth form and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
